Class MicroOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • MicroOptions

  • public class MicroOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple class for configuring and parsing command-line options.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MicroOptions.MissingArgException
      Thrown when the parser can't find the argument for a non-unary option.
      class  MicroOptions.Option
      Core class for defining options using builder-style methods.
      static class  MicroOptions.OptionException
      All option-related exceptions are instances of this base class.
      static class  MicroOptions.RequiredOptionException
      Thrown when the parser can't find a required option.
      static class  MicroOptions.UnsupportedOptionException
      Thrown when the parser encounters an option that has not been defined.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MicroOptions()
      Creates an initially-empty set of options.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getArg(java.lang.String option)
      Returns the argument that was associated with the specified option.
      java.lang.String getArg(java.lang.String option, java.lang.String defaultValue)
      Returns the argument that was associated with the specified option, or the specified default value.
      boolean has(java.lang.String option)
      Returns true iff the specified option was encountered during parsing.
      MicroOptions.Option option(java.lang.String name)
      Configure an optional, no-arg option having the specified name.
      void parse(java.lang.String... strings)
      Parses the specified array of Strings and populates values for all configured options.
      java.lang.String usageString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MicroOptions

        public MicroOptions()
        Creates an initially-empty set of options.

    • Method Detail

      • usageString

        public java.lang.String usageString()
        Returns:
        a human-readable usage string

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String... strings)
        Parses the specified array of Strings and populates values for all configured options.
        Parameters:
        strings - e.g., the arguments on the command line

      • option

        public MicroOptions.Option option(java.lang.String name)
        Configure an optional, no-arg option having the specified name. The name must be non-null, non-empty, and must not start with a hypen. Spaces are allowed but discouraged since they complicate command-line construction in most environments.
        Parameters:
        name - the name to assign to the option
        Returns:
        the option object, which can be used for further configuration
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the name is null, the empty string, or starts with a hyphen
        See Also:
        MicroOptions.Option.describedAs(String), MicroOptions.Option.isRequired(), MicroOptions.Option.isUnary()

      • has

        public boolean has(java.lang.String option)
        Returns true iff the specified option was encountered during parsing.
        Parameters:
        option - the option to look for
        Returns:
        true if so, otherwise false
        Throws:
        MicroOptions.UnsupportedOptionException - if the option hasn't been defined via option(String); also thrown if the name passed to the method is null, the empty string, or starts with a hyphen

      • getArg

        public java.lang.String getArg(java.lang.String option)
        Returns the argument that was associated with the specified option.
        Parameters:
        option - the option to look up the argument for
        Returns:
        the argument, iff the option takes and argument (is not unary) and was encountered during parsing; otherwise, null.
        Throws:
        MicroOptions.UnsupportedOptionException - if the option hasn't been defined via option(String) or is unary (cannot have an argument); also thrown if the name passed to the method is null, the empty string, or starts with a hyphen

      • getArg

        public java.lang.String getArg(java.lang.String option,
                      java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Returns the argument that was associated with the specified option, or the specified default value.
        Parameters:
        option - the option to look up the argument for
        defaultValue - the value to return if the specified option was not encountered during parsing
        Returns:
        the argument, iff the option takes and argument and was not encountered during parsing; otherwise, the specified default value
        Throws:
        MicroOptions.UnsupportedOptionException - if the option hasn't been defined via option(String) or is unary (cannot have an argument); also thrown if the name passed to the method is null, the empty string, or starts with a hyphen
